text: I have some images showing up on a blog page as `.webp`  and some that still show as `.jpg` What is that based on?
This was on my sandbox account. It looks like on the real account it uses srcset (and I think I saw somewhere that the extension shows jpg but they are actually webp?)

When HubSpot auto converts the image will typically still say the original file type in the extension, but the actual returned file is webp.

Some file manager asset handling may be slightly different between sandbox and normal HubSpot accounts because sandbox accounts are not expected to actually receive real-world traffic.
Thanks. Itâ€™s really a great feature.
Yeah, can really take away the need for a lot of complexity and and initial project setup (like build tools form images)

<@U7SL518D6> Assuming we run all of our CSS through HubSpot, the next step is "critical path" CSS. If that happened automatically it would save so much time and effort. I'm going to try to figure out a webpack version but a HubSpot version would be perfect
not exactly critical path but I think I'm going to start with this: <https://purgecss.com/>
